description: Since TT14 files store tax information for the 2014 tax year, they are most commonly created and used in 2015. Tax returns completed with the TurboTax Canada application can be filed electronically or printed and mailed.
NOTE: The previous version of TurboTax Canada (2013) saved tax returns with a .TT13 file extension. The U.S. version of TurboTax 2014 saves files with a .TAX2014 file extension.
